results.title: Robert
results.creator_credit: Cedric Smith, Wolf Koenig, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Robert tells of the identity crisis of a fifteen-year-old whose father walked out years earlier. Already overwhelmed by problems at school, despair at the situation of the world, and his awkwardness with girls, Robert suddenly discovers that his mother has a serious boyfriend. One of a series of six short dramatic discussion starters for adolescents and adults on the subject of teenage alienation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cedric Smith, Wolf Koenig, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Robbie the reindeer in hooves of fire
results.brief_description: Robbie the Reindeer has a big set of hoofprints to follow in - his father is Santa’s beloved Rudolph (he of red-nosed fame). Robbie has come to the North Pole to take his place on Santa’s team but he is a young reindeer who lacks direction and soon realises that he is not fit or disciplined enough to keep up with the others. He must firstly prove himself in the annual Reindeer races to win the respect of his teammates and the love of a girl. In the spirit of animator Nick Park’s ‘Wallace and Gromit’ series and written by some of Britain’s top comics, this is an animated adventure the whole family will enjoy. Voices include those of Robbie Williams, Jane Horrocks, Rhys Ifans, Ricky Tomlinson, Harry Enfield and Ardal O’Hanlon. Music by Mark Knopfler.

results.title: Robbery under arms [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jock Blair, South Australian Film Corporation, ITC Entertainment, Donald Crombie and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Rolf Boldrewood, “Robbery Under Arms” tells the story of the legendary and daring bushranger - Captain Starlight. Starlight (Sam Neill) is the renegade of a noble English family with a taste for fine wine, romance and other men’s cattle. Starlight also has a talent for robbery under arms and with his team, they set out on a trail of adventure and action that takes them through many parts of Australia; mostly in defiance of the law. Cast also includes Ed Devereaux.

results.title: Robbery under arms
results.creator_credit: Pacific Photo Plays and Kenneth Brampton
results.brief_description: Based on the Rolf Boldrewood novel, this film follows the two Marsden brothers and their adventures with the gentlemanly bushranger, Captain Starlight; their romance with local girls, their life on the goldfields and their eventual capture by the police after Starlight is shot. The brothers serve a long prison term, and emerge to start a new life with their patiently waiting sweethearts. Cast includes Kenneth Brampton, Roy Redgrave, S.A. Fitzgerald, William Pearson, Stuart McCrae, Witton Power, Jackie Anderson, H.D. Wise, Tian Hogue, Nan Taylor, Phyllis Ruthcen, Hilda Dorrington, Vera Archer, Austral Nichol, Betty Crock. Reconstructed version by the National Film Archive (ScreenSound).

results.title: Robbery under arms
results.creator_credit: Joseph Janni, Rank Film Productions and Jack Lee
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Rolf Boldrewood, this is the story of the legendary bushranger, Captain Starlight. Set in the bush and goldfields of early Australia, the classic tale comes to life starring Peter Finch as Captain Starlight.

results.title: Rob Roy
results.creator_credit: Talisman, Peter Broughan, Richard Jackson and Michael Caton-Jones
results.brief_description: When a harsh winter threatens the majestic Scottish Highlands, Robert Roy McGregor (Liam Neeson) is forced to borrow money from the not so noble Marquis of Montrose (John Hurt) to provide for his clan. But when Montrose’s evil henchmen (brilliantly portrayed by Tim Roth and Brian Cox) conspire to take the wealth for themselves, they thrust Rob into the most challenging battle of his life, one that escalates into a bloody and gripping climax. Breathtaking landscapes, steamy romance and non-stop action combine to make this a thrilling and powerful adventure.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Talisman, Peter Broughan, Richard Jackson and Michael Caton-Jones

results.title: Roar: Melbourne expressionism in the 1980s
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australasia, Traudi Allen and Peter Wiseman
results.brief_description: Formed in 1982, Roar Studios and the Roar group became synonymous with expressionism, abstract art and the emergence of a new group of talented young Australian artists that helped alter the future course of the teaching and exhibition of art in Australia. This was achieved through the breakdown of the stifling mores of the Australian art world of the time. Through interviews with artists from the original Roar group at a reunion exhibition at Roar 2 in the 1990s, critical discussion of the social circumstances and firm philosophies of the group as well as their key works, this program is an insightful study of one of the first artist run galleries and studios in Melbourne. It explores the experiences, international and local interests, and the diversity of artistic styles but shared influences of the artists who made it happen. It also discusses the significant impact of Roar on the facilitation of exhibitions for women and ethnic artists and on the emergence of an independent Australian art. The Roar artists profiled and interviewed include David Larwill, Pasquale Giardino, Stephen McCarthy, Jill Noble, Tony Mighell, Sarah Faulkner, Mark Howson, Peter Ferguson and Trevor Hoppen. The 26 minute documentary is followed by 20 minutes of extended viewing of stills of key artworks.

results.title: Roar culture
results.brief_description:
‘Roar culture’ is a successful six month community arts project that was documented on video. The project brought together schools, community groups, artists, people from culturally diverse backgrounds and local government, including over 80 students, 10 storytellers, and 14 artists/mentors. ‘Roar culture’ explores issues of identity concerning ethnic, religious & sexual discrimination, cultural diversity and tolerance.
In doing so, it was critical to the process that there was a space for understanding and insight: a space where the many faces and voices which contribute to Bendigo’s historical and contemporary image and identity, were paid attention.
Stage one: the project’s starting point was the narrative or story. Stories from 10 multicultural & indigenous individuals whose memories ranged from the 1930s through to today, from places and countries which hauntingly navigated us to Bendigo. Each told a different story about living in regional Victoria however the threads of isolation, language difficulties, fragmented families and broader cultural or religious differences provided significant links.
Stage two was a mentor program, which furthered the developed the artistic skills of the students through a variety of cultural & arts mediums. These included workshops exploring Aboriginal dance; Japanese movement and theatre; contemporary and traditional music from a cross section of cultures; photojournalism and visual art mediums.
Stage three included a series of round table discussions and practical workshops uniting the stories of Stage One with the skills development of Stage Two. This enabled scripts & a musical score to be written for the final stage.
Stage four included performance rehearsals & backstage skills development which culminated in an experimental performance through multi-disciplined artforms in the round at The Capital Theatre on July 16 &17 1999.
Participating in this project were students & teachers from Bendigo Senior Secondary College with members of the stage design crew from Girton Grammar School and Catholic College. An original score of music was composed by local musicians and performed by the Bendigo Youth Orchestra. Financial partners were City of Greater Bendigo, Festivals Australia, The Myer Foundation & Victorian Multicultural Commission.
‘Roar culture’ was awarded the 1999 Local Government & the Arts Leadership Award for Best Practice Management of a Cultural Project

Lynda Newton
Project & Artistic Director
